sen.j: 森下 道誉（もりした どうよ、? - 天正9年10月24日（1581年11月20日））は安土桃山時代の人物、武将。
sen.e: Doyo MORISHITA (date of birth unknown - November 30, 1581) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in Azuchi Momoyama Period.
Doyo MORISHITA (year of birth unknown - November 30, 1581) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: year of birth unknown、in the Azuchi-Momoyama periodに修正
sen.e: Doyo MORISHITA (year of birth unknown - November 30, 1581) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 四郎左衛門尉、のち出羽守、諱は吉途（よしみち）。
sen.e: He served as Shiro-saemonnojo and Dewa no kami (the governor of Dewa Province), and his imina (personal name) was Yoshimichi.

sen.j: 山名豊国の重臣で山名氏の家臣・森下氏の一族と見られるが、詳細は不明である。
sen.e: Doyo was a senior vassal of Toyokuni YAMANA and it is considered that he was a member of the Morishita clan, the vassal of the Yamana clan, however, the details are unknown.

sen.j: なお、よく知られている「道誉」という名は入道号である。
sen.e: And also, the well-known name "Doyo" was his Nyudo go (the title of priest).

sen.j: 天正8年（1580年）、織田氏に降った主君の山名豊国を中村春続らと共に鳥取城より追放し、吉川経家を新城主として迎えた。
sen.e: In 1580, he expelled the lord, Toyokuni YAMANA, who surrendered to the Oda clan with Harutsugu NAKAMURA, and welcomed Tsuneie KIKKAWA as a new castellan.
In 1580, he expelled the lord, Toyokuni YAMANA, who surrendered to the Oda clan from Tottori-jo Castle with Harutsugu NAKAMURA, and welcomed Tsuneie KIKKAWA as a new castellan.
sen.cmt: 「鳥取城より」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: In 1580, he expelled the lord, Toyokuni YAMANA, who surrendered to the Oda clan from Tottori-jo Castle with Harutsugu NAKAMURA, and welcomed Tsuneie KIKKAWA as a new castellan.

sen.j: 翌年の鳥取城の際には城内に籠り、度々豊臣秀吉率いる包囲陣への夜討ちを行った。
sen.e: Next year, at the time of the Siege of Tottori-jo Castle, they holed up in the castle and made a night attack on besieging army led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI for several times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Next year, at the time of the Siege of Tottori-jo Castle, they holed up in the castle and made a night attack on besieging army led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI for several times.
Next year, at the time of the Siege of Tottori-jo Castle, they holed up in the castle and made a night attack on besieging army led by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI for several times.

sen.j: しかし、兵糧攻めにより10月下旬に吉川経家が自刃し、城が開城すると中村春続と同様に戦乱を起こした罪によって切腹を命じられて11月20日、自刃した。
sen.e: However, after Tsuneie KIKKAWA committed suicide with his sword in near the end of October because of starvation policy by Hedeyoshi and Doyo surrendered the castle to the enemy, he and Harutsugu NAKAMURA were commanded to commit seppuku on the charge of starting the war, and committed suicide with his sword on November 20.
